Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is covered with a black deposit, the exterior is very worn and bears traces of two Coptic characters written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393325) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393325)
